block.p: Suzanne deBruyn Robbins and John Cawthra Taylor were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Albert A. Kenney performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola.

Mrs. Taylor, 35, is the special events assistant for the Big Apple Circus in New York. She graduated from Wellesley College. She is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward H. Robbins of Colares, Portugal. Her father retired as an independent consultant in Lisbon on housing finance and urban development.
Suzanne deBruyn Robbins and John Cawthra Taylor were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Albert A. Kenney performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola.

Mrs. Taylor, 35, is the special events assistant for the Big Apple Circus in New York. She graduated from Wellesley College. She is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward H. Robbins of Colares, Portugal. Her father retired as an independent consultant in Lisbon on housing finance and urban development.

Mr. Taylor, 36, teaches science to the fifth and sixth grades at Friends Seminary in New York. He is also the head of the school's science department. He graduated from the University of Massachusetts and received a master's degree in early adolescent education from the Bank Street College of Education. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. DeCourcy L. Taylor Jr. of Austin, Tex. His father is a wildlife artist and the art director for the Atlantic Salmon Journal in Montreal.
The couple met in New York in 1997 when they were cast members of the Blue Hill Troupe's production of ''The Sorcerer.''
